qas.question: According to Hayek, with the rule of law in place what will help people make more wise investments?

answers.text: confidence in a successful return on investment

qas.question: According to Hayek, limited governemnt power through the rule of law does not do what to people?
According to Hayek, people are free to do what within the rule of law?

answers.text: pursue his personal ends and desires

qas.question: Who studied how the rule of law might hurt free market?
Under rule along whose efforts can government stifle?
Hooters rule of law key from pursuing personal ends and desires?

context: The <a0_0>economist<a0_0/> <b4_0>F. A. Hayek<b4_0/> analyzed how the Rule of Law might be beneficial to the free market. Hayek proposed that under the Rule of Law individuals would be able to make wise investments and future plans with some <a1_0>confidence in a successful return on investment<a1_0/> when he stated: "under the Rule of Law the government is prevented from stultifying <b5_0>individual efforts<b5_0/> by ad hoc action. Within the known rules of the game <b6_0>the individual<b6_0/> is free to <a3_0>pursue his personal ends and desires<a3_0/>, certain that the powers of government will not be used deliberately to <a2_0>frustrate his efforts<a2_0/>."
